Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Sprinkle
Reviews.Content: I had the older C123 and we used it for everything from the beach, creek, pool, hot tub, inside, outside, hot, cold, wet, dry, dusty, 5 year old, grandma, everything and everybody! We loved it. I was very happy to find the newer version C135. I ordered 2. So far, we have only used one but it is great! I love the picture and video quality. I have not tried them underwater yet but I will be doing that soon. I recently bought a Nikkon waterproof camera and I was completely disgusted with the picture quality. I returned it in like 3 days. I am very picky and hard to please so it says a lot that I am so happy with this camera. Unlike the Nikkon, with this camera I can control the flash with ON, OFF, and AUTO settings with the touch of a button. Also, I can change settings (underwater, etc) with the touch of a button. I don't have to acces a menu which makes using the camera quicker and easier. Always a plus!

Reviews.Title: Kodak C135- worked great!
Reviews.Author: Judith J. Gossett
Reviews.Content: Had my worries since Kodak has quit making cameras, but have to say that I couldn't be happier with the purchase! Paid roughly $75!Shot pics and video for 6 straight days in Kauai and our family took video and pics in the pool on three occasions as well.There seem to be two different review links on Amazon; one with 700+ reviews, which seems to be lumped with the older C123 model, and then this review batch with only a dozen or so. Looking at the reviews in the larger group, I was apprehensive about fatal failures listed of water leaking into the battery compartment, so when I got the camera I checked out the compartment doors.There is an outer door and an inner door. The inner door hinges shut, then you have to slide it a bit to ensure it is fully closed. Just speculating, but it may be the case that the leaks listed on reviews are due to the inner door not being properly slid shut?Picture and video quality were fantastic. Was even able to adjust resolution underwater rather easily. To be honest, I should have studied the functional menu a bit more before taking it in the water, but it was fairly intuitional.Was pleasantly surprised at how long the battery life was on the camera. Could get a pair of Duracell's to last through two days of snorkeling (3 sessions per day, probably 200 pics and a couple dozen videos of 1 minute or less each). Read other reviews where this was not the case, but this is an honest assessment.At the most I only dove to a depth of 6 feet or so (2 meters max). Water temp was 78 degrees everyday. Had no issues with the lens fogging up as others did in the C123/C135 review column (700+ reviews).I am very happy to have snagged one of these cameras while they were still available for this trip!! Bargain!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for your vacation needs!!!  (Use good Enhancing software)
Reviews.Author: AmazonAaron
Reviews.Content: I got this camera specifically for above- and underwater use on a snorkeling trip, and it did an amazing job.  the camera was very easy to use, again whether above or underwater.  I love the separate video button, especialy when snorkeling giving you one-click access to video.My only complaint regarding use of the camera was that I had to keep putting it back into H2O mode while snorkeling; when the camera went to sleep it reset itself to Auto.The pictures I took underwater looked rather green on the screen and when first uploaded to a computer, but once I used some editing software and just pressed the "Auto Enhance" button, the underwater pictures POPPED with gorgeous color the camera had captured!  The Enhancing also helped the above-water pictures have brighter and truer colors (blue and greens).  (This camera did not come with software; I was using some software that came with my kids Coleman cameras.)Warning: this camera sinks!  So get a floating wrist strap to go with it. (intersetingly the Coleman cameras I got the kids floated by themselves, but weren't overall as nice as this one.)The camera did suck down batteries; i put in three new sets of AAs over 5 days of intermittent use.  The camera would say it had half a battery left, but then it would turn itself off when I tried to take a picture, so be sure they are full before you set out for the day to avoid getting disappointed.I had NO issues with water leakage.  There are two doors protecting the batteries and SD card, and I could possibly see that if you only closed the outer one without seating the inner one first you could suffer leakage, but properly closing both doors in turn seemed to create a tight seal.  My only question is how long that tight seal will hold up over months or years of use...that has yet to be determined.Finally this camera does not come with an SD card.  This seems to be standard practice now, although they don't mention that in the specs, so I thought i'd point it out.  It takes a full-sized card, not micro.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: wadep
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera before we went to Cancun, and on our first day there we had taken over 100 pics and vids and when we were looking at the pics the camera deleted all of them. Very upsetting but at least it was the first day and not the last. Then a few days later the lens fogged up a number of times and we never took the camera below 6 inches worth of water. I am currently trying to either get my money back or get a different one to try out. Maybe the one we got was just a fluke, I don't know. Good luck either way.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the kids, excellent underwater
Reviews.Author: M. S. Haley
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras for my sons to take on a trip to the islands.  They spent the week snorkeling everyday, sometimes diving down 10-15 feet to take pictures of turtles, fish, coral, etc.  The cameras performed flawlessly, the picture quality is excellent, and the kids loved having something to do while in the water and at the beach.  Not a drop of water penetrated the camera housing.  I highly recommend this camera, it's easy to use and performs exactly as advertised.  Bravo Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Very successful underwater, auto setting, and pre-set scene choices pictures
Reviews.Author: TexasGal
Reviews.Content: This camera did exactly what I needed, and that was to take underwater pictures.  Used on two different cruises and worked well both times. The nice surprise is how well pictures taken on auto setting are.  It is a handy little camera.  It has a few scene settings which worked well.  I also used it to take indoor shots at shows at Disney World with the flash turned off and got really great pictures.Make sure you follow the directions after replacing batteries and/or memory card. There is a small orange door that covers the batteries and memory card. Close that door first then the outer door of the camera itself.  This is two separate steps which are  necessary to make sure the waterproof feature works.Also used the video feature which is again a pleasant surprise. No issues at all. The zoom does get a bit grainy if you are really far away.Was very pleased with my pictures, the overall features (i.e.: auto setting, waterproof feature, choice of scene settings, video, and zoom) I also liked the size of the camera.. The screen is hard to see in bright sunlight, but that seems to be a common issue with just about any digital camera. Overall....Great little camera for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for 3 months and it worked great both on water and land. The pictures it takes are very clear. After 3 months though, it turned off and never turned on again. I changed the batteries, plugged it in to my computer, etc. but no luck. I recommend buying the warranty, as I'm seriously regretting passing on that option.

Reviews.Title: Simple and easy to use
Reviews.Author: thatguy123
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and easy to use.Camera works well under the water.Wish it had separate button for Sport Shots like they do for flipping to video.Motion shots need to be in sports mode but hard to get there when in motion.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: aprilcrandall
Reviews.Content: didn`t leak, easy too use, clear pictures, encough light in pictures, takes good pictures in and out of water.  Zoom is only digiital zoom, but that is okay cause I just bought it for water use..  Was submerged for a great deal of time while I was snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: John Hawley
Reviews.Content: I used it minimally for my trip but if you're going on vacation to some place tropical and will be scuba diving or snorkeling, this is a good little camera for the price.  The underwater photos were really good quality.  Otherwise for regular pictures I expected the 14 MP to be a bit crisper but that's ok, it fills the bill.

Reviews.Title: Early Review
Reviews.Author: ShellyP
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, it takes very nice clear pictures.  I have not yet used it under water and will update this review after I have done that in a month or so.  I am using it with the eye-fi card which is something you should definitely check out.  I was (am?) worried about the number of customers who said this did not work underwater and ruined their sd cards.  This camera has two doors to protect the battery/sd card compartment.  The manual warns to not close them together, but to shut/lock the inner door and then shut the outer door.  I can see how it might seem you just need to close the top door.  I'll be paying attention to that and will update on how it does.  More to come....Update (moving 4 stars to 5):I have now taken the camera on a snorkeling trip and it did great.  No leaking at all. Definitely make sure you shut the inner door and then the outer door.  On a guided snorkeling trip, the guide took my camera and took pics and videos for me.  He dived down quite deep a few times to get shots down in crevices and those turned out great.  For videos that I took, I merely started the video, then pointed it in the same general area I was moving.  Trying to see the viewfinder underwater is difficult as some have said.  But who wants to look through a viewfinder when you're snorkeling live? :-)  I definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: ok for the price
Reviews.Author: dissatisfied
Reviews.Content: The pics are decent.  The underwater feature is cool, but it once you take a picture it takes forever for you to be able to take another one.  Also if you want to review the picture it takes a long time.

Reviews.Title: Easy Share sport C 135
Reviews.Author: Carole M. Metelenis
Reviews.Content: Lets say I don't believe always the negative about things.  Try to go with the positive attitude.  I read a lot about this camera before I purchased it.  So I went more with the positives. We purchased it for a cruise doing snorkeling.  Lets say we got 3 pictures and the camera died.  Some how water got in the camera and it wouldn't work.  We should have bought something else.  We have no pictures of our 7 days of water activities.  We dried it out for the whole vacation and it still doesn't work.  We recharged the batteries and also brought other batteries.  So it wasn't the batteries.  Still isn't working and now I am glad I bought the 2 year protection not that it is doing me any good now.  Will have to contact them about what will be done.  So my rating is not a happy shopper.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof
Reviews.Author: DianainFl
Reviews.Content: So, I work outdoors for banks mowing lawns and were in Florida. It rains... a lot, daily almost. Waterproof is awesome, quality of pictures is awesome and the lens doesn't open so the dirt the mowers kick up can get in and jam up the lens... awesome!4 stars because when you have a memory card in the camera that has a bunch of pictures on it the camera take 7 min. to shut off. It just says Kodak for 7 min, so odd. In my situation that is a complete downer because I mow 30 properties a day I want to turn it off while I am driving to the next property to save on AA battery life but its pointless because it will just stay on anyway.Also 4 stars because with the memory card having pictures on it you cannot review a photo without the camera saying processing for 5 min. Again servicing 30 properties a day and I need to see if I got a shot or not I did keep making the mistake of hitting that button the first few days. Now I just take an extra picture and delete it if I dont need it!I delete the pictures every day but we are required to take 50 pictures of each house we service so usually by the 3rd house you can turn it off or review photos.

Reviews.Title: Fun
Reviews.Author: mathew park
Reviews.Content: It works great under water. Took pics of some fishes swimming around. Difficult to see through the screen. Out of water pictures are below average.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: V. Stiles
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I lost my Nikon coolpix waterproof camera after owning it for less than a week. I didn't want to spend another $200 for another camera that I knew I might possibly lose again since we float rough rapids. I wanted a waterproof camera because we kayak alot and I needed something that we could take with us to capture our adventures. My girlfriend is always raving about Kodak Easyshare cameras and how she has always had great luck with them. So I figured for the price, why not give it a shot. After the second day, I was HOPING the river would claim it so I would never have to see it again. Finally my girlfriend even got sick of it and asked me to return it. The best thing about it all was that they were great about accepting the product back. They had UPS come to my house and pick it up the next day and within a week I had the money refunding to my account. I use Amazon a lot, I never write reviews unless I love a product. Just in the last 6 months I have ordered about 50 items from Amazon, and this is the only item I have EVER returned.Pros:It turned onIt took picturesIt was waterproofCons:5 times we selected to delete one picture, it would delete ALL of them. This was within a span of 2 weeks. This was very frustrating since we were always out on a river and it was usually toward the end of the trip and it would just erase all the pictures we had taken and had not had a chance to download yet.The pictures were horrible quality. Most the pictures looked like they were taken through a screen or a thick piece of plastic. I know what settings to use and how to clean a lens, so this was not user error.It didn't take videos for longer than 20 seconds (and we had a 64 gig memory card, with just 2 pictures on it)

Reviews.Title: No supporting software
Reviews.Author: skip
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 hours with Kodaks web support & their online suppoet chat, I gave up. The customer can no longer download the software required to transfer pictures to your computer or to upload them to Face Book. You can not even register this model for warrenty. Their own web site says they do not provide the download any longer and they are sorry for the inconveince.

Reviews.Title: Mixed Bag
Reviews.Author: Lindsay M. Mendicino
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews and ultimately decided to buy this camera because if some of the negatives really were true (doesn't work properly after being in water), I figured I wouldn't be out that much money. Overall, it takes very nice photos. I did experience the issue that others have mentioned that after it has been in the water, even just for short periods of time, and not totally submerged, the colors on the screen become washed out and the LCD screen becomes almost totally useless. I did what I read others had done - took out the batteries and memory card and let it dry out overnight and it worked fine the next day. The interesting part is, sometimes it would take photos fine while the screen was washed out and not working and sometimes that is actually how your photos would turn out - no way to know for sure though.Generally though, it took great photos under water and on land as well. Just know that as soon as you put it in water, you'll likely not be able to use it again until the next day. Given the cost of the camera, I wasn't that disappointed. But if you need something that will absolutely work, no matter what and with no hassle, I would recommend a better quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak does not support ther products!!
Reviews.Author: Cloudshadow
Reviews.Content: Tried to down load the software as instructed so I could look at the pictures I taken. I tried several time to down load but the program said there was a error every time. I went to the Kodak website only to find that they do not down load the software or even have it anymore. When I sent them an email asking them for the software to make my camera work they told me to take a hike, that I could contract an outside vender and my be find some software that mite work. To be clear I an asking Amazon to return the camera and refund my money.Patton

Reviews.Title: Its the BEST
Reviews.Author: SAR Indiana
Reviews.Content: Best little camera I have ever had plus its water proof, takes great under water photo's and video in clear water also works great for everyday stuff

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: metoo
Reviews.Content: It is fine for the price. I spend a lot of time around water with my grandchildren and wanted a "safe" camera to take family memories. I was a little disappointed with the movie quality, but for the price, it's ok.  It is nice to have two separate buttons, one for stills and one for movies. (No fooling around finding the right setting.) it's nice to have a camera that you don't have to worry about around water or little ones!

Reviews.Title: Small viewing screen
Reviews.Author: Dawn Vogel
Reviews.Content: It's an ok little camera. The screen is really hard to see any kind of detail. I sometimes couldnt tell for sure that the picture was good. Otherwise a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Warning Deletes All Your Photos!!!!
Reviews.Author: A Disney Family
Reviews.Content: Do Not Delete Any Pictures!!! I got this camera since my son loves the water and could get plenty of pictures of him in the pool. The camera works great in and out of the water but do not try deleting any pictures on the camera no matter what while the SD card is in the camera. We spent a day with the family and grandparents taking some memorial pictures. During a down time I was going thru the camera deleting the blurry pictures and for some reason it selected delete all. I may have pushed down instead of up selecting it but then it went to ask me to confirm my choice. I selected to NOT delete all my pics. The camera then took it upon itself to delete all my pictures. The part that really stinks is that when I put the SD card in our computer to try and recover the pictures from the accidental deletion the camera had not only deleted the pictures it total made them disappear. There was nothing on the SD card to recover. The camera permanently deleted the pictures. : ( Wish I had read the other reviews here of people having had the camera delete their pictures before I had purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Fernando Rosete
Reviews.Content: We took this on a vacation to the beach. Swam with it and took some cool videos and pictures.This little camera did a great job. It is obvious that the zoom is not the best, but it worked very well for video and basic picture capabilities.

Reviews.Title: First waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: Camera worked well in salt water and took decent photo's, which appeared to be better than those taken by a friends more expensive camera. Only problem I had was that the batteries ran down to quickly. If you purchase one, have an extra set of batteries when taking photos you don't want to miss out on the moment.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: iPhone 4S User
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use for a snorkeling trip to Mexico.  It worked great in up to about 10 feet of water (I didn't try it any deeper than that).  I took both stills and video and used the telephoto extensively.  The quality was very good, but not great.  What do you expect for a waterproof camera for under $100?  My goal was to capture memories of the trip, not to shoot photos for National Geographic.  The sound on the video was a little strange in the water, but you would expect that with underwater sounds.  No problems with leaking any water into the camera.  Battery life was decent.  It uses two AA batteries.  I had backups, but I only needed one set for a couple of hours of snorkeling and shooting pictures/video with plenty of battery life left over.  For the price, I thought it was a great buy and perfect for what I needed.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: BG "Bob G"
Reviews.Content: And simple enough for a young child plus it's inexpensive. If it breaks it's a throw away. Pay attention to the sealing gaskets when you close it and it's quite waterproof. I put a very light coat of vaseline on them. It works.

Reviews.Title: Great, inexpensive little camera..
Reviews.Author: jimt
Reviews.Content: Got this when it was only $80. Can't believe it's up to $120.  We took it to the beach several times and it has performed great. Water and sand had no effect on the camera.  It takes pretty good photos and video but not great. The SD card seems a little slow but we replaced ours with a faster one. All in all for the money this little waterproof camera is a great buy though I wouldn't pay more then $100 for it. Sure beats using the disposable waterproof cameras and paying all that money to develop it. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: kodak easysport c 135 camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara R. Helwig
Reviews.Content: This is one of the easiest cameras to use so far we took about 500 pictures in all kinds of lightning conditions and have not had a bad picture.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for us!
Reviews.Author: Homeschooling mom
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for us on our cruise to the Caribbean.  No leaking (we were very careful when closing the battery compartment to seat the inner seal well) and the underwater pictures came out really well.  But I would think of it only as an alternative to the cheap film-based throwaway underwater cameras; it was really lousy as a regular camera, primarily because the zoom isn't smooth (it moves back and forth in jumps).  Also, I never was able to figure out (even looking through the "manual" (which was actually more like a multi-folded pamphlet)) how to change the length of time a picture is displayed as a preview after the picture is taken.  It seemed like an eternity (probably more like 5 seconds) before the camera would put the viewfinder back on and let me take another picture.  But the pictures came out really well, and in the end, that's all that matters to me.

Reviews.Title: Excellent rafting camera
Reviews.Author: Frassmaker
Reviews.Content: As I was going rafting and did not want to risk taking my regular camera for fear of water damage. I purchased this unit.It worked extremely well, it did get wet with no ill effects.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: ROBIN
Reviews.Content: bought as a present for my wife to use when the grandkids come and they go to the beach.  it works well and the software etc downloaded which another reviewer said might be a problem. so good I might buy another just for me

Reviews.Title: Does just what it says it does
Reviews.Author: Nibrocla
Reviews.Content: Used this for some snorkeling in the Florida Keys and had zero problems with it - battery compartment tight, adjustments easy to make.  Only quibble is that it doesn't hold in underwater mode - ya gotta remember to put it there after you've turned it off.  No biggie...

Reviews.Title: Perfect For Intended Use
Reviews.Author: Patski
Reviews.Content: This seems to be a great little camera. I bought it for my son who is soon to embark on a Scout high adventure trip and is the photographer for his team. The problem is he is very hard on cameras. He needed something that could take some abuse but still preform. He put it to the test this past weekend on a strenuous hike and it took great pictures. Pics with the zoom are a bit noisy but for the price and its functionality the camera is perfect for our needs. He doesn't intend to use it underwater, but at least we know rain won't be a problem. And best of all it is one of the only rugged cameras that takes regular batteries. For almost two weeks they will not have access to electric and so can't charge a rechargeable battery. He will have to carry plenty of batteries but so far the lithiums we put in have lasted pretty long. Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: hls
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our 10yr old daughter. She loves it. Great price for the functionality. She uses it in our pool with friends and at the ocean. I highly recommend it for a great fun camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
One-button Wi-Fi sharing with Eye-Fi card (not included)
14 megapixels
2.4 in Bright LCD
Waterproof to 16 ft., and Dustproof
Kodak's Smart Capture feature
ProductInfo.Name: EasyShare Sport C135 14 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 2.4-Inch LCD (Red) (New Model)
